Introduction
J. Antonio Baeza is an evolutionary ecologist. He tests sex allocation & mating systems theories using invertebrates as model systems. He is also interested in understanding the role of the environment in determining the evolution of social behaviors within a phylogenetic framework. He is an assistant professor at the Department of Biological Sciences, Clemson University.
